data.title: Grizzlies sign Winston; Bobcats re-sign Wallace
authors: From combined reports, The Tuscaloosa News
data.meta_description: MEMPHIS, Tenn. | The Memphis Grizzlies signed rookie free agent Kennedy Winston on Wednesday. \n Winston, a 6-foot-6, 230-pound guard, averaged 16.2 points, 5.3 rebounds and 2.2 assists in 82 games atâ€¦
data.text:
MEMPHIS, Tenn. | The Memphis Grizzlies signed rookie free agent Kennedy Winston on Wednesday.

Winston, a 6-foot-6, 230-pound guard, averaged 16.2 points, 5.3 rebounds and 2.2 assists in 82 games at the University of Alabama.

Winston entered the 2005 NBA Draft after his junior season. He led the SEC in scoring (17.9 points per game) as a junior and was named to the All-SEC first team as a sophomore and junior while finishing his career ranked 20th among all-time Crimson Tide scorers with 1,325 points.

Winston played on the Grizzlies' 2005 Summer Pro League team, averaging 6.6 points, 2.1 rebounds and 1.0 assists in seven games.

Gerald Wallace re-signs

CHARLOTTE, N.C. | With the opening of training camp one week away, the Charlotte Bobcats have finalized their roster by re-signing forward Gerald Wallace.

"We are happy that Gerald will continue his career and development with the Charlotte Bobcats. He is a quality young man," Bobcats general manager and head coach Bernie Bickerstaff said.

Wallace -- a former University of Alabama player -- averaged 11.1 points, 5.5 rebounds, 2.0 assists, 1.6 steals and 1.3 blocks in 30.7 minutes last season. He ranked ninth in steals and 31st in blocks. He hit double figures in scoring 39 times and had seven games with more than 20 points.

The 6-7, 215-pound forward appeared in 70 games with 68 starts. He scored a career-high 28 points at Utah on Feb. 1, and pulled down a career-high 14 rebounds at New York on Dec. 26, and again on April 16, against New York.

Wallace was drafted by Sacramento with the 25th overall pick in 2001 and spent three seasons with Kings. He was chosen by the Bobcats in the expansion draft in 2004.
